f1889ceb-6b27-481b-b4fa-7d2e0ca8c035.description: Designed to provide pre-service teachers with the knowledge and skills to effectively manage classrooms at a variety of grade levels and in diverse settings by (1) identifying and evaluating CM principles and strategies; (2) observing and evaluating CM practices and impact on student learning in a classroom setting; and (3) creating, delivering, and reflecting on a learning activity that incorporates successful CM principles and strategies.
f1889ceb-6b27-481b-b4fa-7d2e0ca8c035.name: Maryland Accelerates Classroom Management

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: High-Leverage Teaching Practices
alignments.description: High-leverage practices are the fundamentals of teaching. These practices are used constantly and are critical to helping students learn important content. The high-leverage practices are also central to supporting students’ social and emotional development. These high-leverage practices are used across subject areas, grade levels, and contexts.

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium
alignments.description: InTASC Core Teaching Standards outline what teachers should know and be able to do to ensure every PK-12 student reaches the goal of being ready to enter college or the workforce. This “common core” outlines the principles and foundations of teaching practice that cut across all subject areas and grade levels and that all teachers share.

badge_template_activities.title: Explores and evaluates classroom management theories/models (INTASC 3d, 3k; HLP 7).
Analyzes and summarizes various classroom management strategies designed to meet the needs of diverse classroom(s) (INTASC 3d, 3k; HLP 5, 7, 8).
Identifies and evaluates perspectives on classroom management in diverse classrooms (INTASC  3d, 3k; HLP 7, 8).
Evaluates and reflects on organization and management strategies observed in diverse classrooms  (INTASC 3d, 3k; HLP 5, 7, 8).
Integrates and implements organization and management strategies as appropriate for the learning contexts (INTASC 3d, 3f, 3k; HLP 5, 7, 8).
Assesses options and plans actions (INTASC 9b, 9e, 10f; HLP 5, 7, 8).
Reflects on actions and areas for personal and professional growth (INTASC 9l, 10f; HLP 5, 7, 8, 19).

51fbcd1d-3b85-42b9-a7d9-cfdc07c33c63.description: This badge is designed for pre-service teachers to develop, demonstrate, and communicate competencies in cultural perspectives and growth mindset. Pre-service teachers (1) identify and evaluate how culture perspectives and growth mindset influence classroom instruction and interactions; (2) observe and evaluate impact of cultural perspectives and growth mindset in a classroom; and (3) create, deliver, and reflect on a learning activity that incorporates cultural diversity and growth mindset.
51fbcd1d-3b85-42b9-a7d9-cfdc07c33c63.name: Maryland Accelerates Cultural Diversity and Growth Mindset

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium
alignments.description: InTASC Core Teaching Standards that outline what teachers should know and be able to do to ensure every PK-12 student reaches the goal of being ready to enter college or the workforce. This “common core” outlines the principles and foundations of teaching practice that cut across all subject areas and grade levels and that all teachers share.

alignments.name: High-Leverage Practices
alignments.description: High-leverage practices are the fundamentals of teaching. These practices are used constantly and are critical to helping students learn important content. The high-leverage practices are also central to supporting students’ social and emotional development. These high-leverage practices are used across subject areas, grade levels, and contexts.

badge_template_activities.title: Explores and reflects on how cultural diversity and contexts influence personal perspectives and practices in education settings (InTASC 2d, 2j; HLP 10, 12)
Explores, identifies, and synthesizes growth mindset principles and strategies to better support learning and development (InTASC 2j; HLP 12)
Identifies and evaluates cultural diversity and growth mindset principles and strategies observed in a classroom setting (InTASC 2g; HLP 19)

Evaluates, documents, and reflects how contexts influence teaching strategies and on use of cultural diversity and growth mindset principles and strategies to address diverse learning needs (InTASC 2d, 2m, 2n, 5p, 10q; HLP 19)
Designs and delivers a learning experience integrating cultural diversity and growth mindset to better engage and support student learning (InTASC 2a, 9e, 10d; HLP 19)
Evaluates and reflects on effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement (InTASC 9l, 9m; HLP 19)

skills.name: Communication In A Diverse And Changing Workplace

28a00835-0fb8-4262-8290-8eabf9e6cb1c.description: The Maryland Accelerates Computational Thinking I Microcredential is designed to introduce the core computer science concepts from the Maryland K-12 Computer Science Standards: Computing Systems, Networks and the Internet, Data and Analysis, Algorithms and Programming, and Impacts of Computing on Society. While gaining knowledge about these core concepts, earners practice mapping the standards to their specific grade band and learning how to incorporate them into their teaching practice.
28a00835-0fb8-4262-8290-8eabf9e6cb1c.name: Maryland Accelerates Computational Thinking

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: High-Leverage Practices
alignments.description: High-leverage practices are the fundamentals of teaching. These practices are used constantly and are critical to helping students learn important content. The high-leverage practices are also central to supporting students’ social and emotional development. These high-leverage practices are used across subject areas, grade levels, and contexts.

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium
alignments.description: InTASC Core Teaching Standards outline what teachers should know and be able to do to ensure every PK-12 student reaches the goal of being ready to enter college or the workforce. This “common core” outlines the principles and foundations of teaching practice that cut across all subject areas and grade levels and that all teachers share.

alignments.name: ISTE Standards for Educators
alignments.description: The ISTE Standards for Educators define the digital age skills and pedagogical insights educators need to teach, work, and learn.

badge_template_activities.title: Explores and reflects on how computational thinking influences personal perspectives and practices in education settings (InTASC 4k, 4l, 4r; HLP 19; ISTE 1a, 1b).
Explores, identifies, and synthesizes computational thinking principles and strategies to better support learning and development  (InTASC 1d, 2j, 10e; HLP 19; ISTE 1c, 4a, 5a, 5b).
Identifies and evaluates computational thinking principles and strategies (InTASC 2g, 5r, 7a; HLP 19; ISTE 1a, 2c, 4a).

Evaluates, documents, and reflects how contexts influence teaching strategies and on use of computational thinking principles and strategies to address diverse learning needs (InTASC 2g, 5p, 7m, 10q; HLP 19, ISTE 5a, 5b, 6c, 6d).
Designs a learning experience integrating computational thinking to better engage and support student learning (InTASC 3i, 8n, 9d, 10d; HLP 19; ISTE 4a, 5a, 5b, 5c, 6c, 6d).
Evaluates and reflects on strategies for improvement (InTASC 7q, 9l, 10m; HLP 19; ISTE 1a).

cc570f1d-2015-412e-88b6-2d1a6790f509.description: The Cultural Diversity and Growth Mindset MicroCredential is designed for pre-service teachers to develop, demonstrate, and communicate competencies in cultural perspectives and growth mindset that are necessary to better engage and support P-12 students in diverse school settings.
cc570f1d-2015-412e-88b6-2d1a6790f509.name: Cultural Awareness and Growth Mindset

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: Intasc Standard 2
alignments.description: Explores and reflects on how cultural diversity and growth mindset contexts influence personal perspectives and practices in education settings (InTASC 2d, 2j) Designs and delivers a learning experience integrating cultural diversity and growth mindset (InTASC 2d, 2m, 2n)

alignments.name: Intasc Standard 5
alignments.description: Evaluates, documents, and reflects how contexts influence teaching strategies and on use of cultural diversity and growth mindset principles and strategies to address diverse learning needs (InTASC 5p)

alignments.name: Intasc Standard 9
alignments.description: Evaluates and reflects on effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement (InTASC 9l, 9m)

badge_template_activities.title: This credential signifies the completion of a module that identify and evaluate how cultural perspectives and growth mindset influence classroom instruction and interactions; (2) observe and evaluate impact of cultural perspectives and growth mindset in a classroom setting; and (3) create, deliver, and reflect on a learning activity that incorporates competencies in cultural diversity.

c393f75f-f747-47bc-a3a1-b1b8a6df7b04.description: The Family Engagement MicroCredential is designed for pre-service teachers to investigate, research, and implement best practices of engaging families in support of student learning and achievement. Integrating evidence-based pedagogies, high-impact field experiences, and performance-based assessments, participants will demonstrate competencies and achievements as knowledge generators in classrooms and change makers in their professions and our communities.
c393f75f-f747-47bc-a3a1-b1b8a6df7b04.name: Family Engagement

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: Intasc Standard 1
alignments.description: Co-designs and co-implements a parent-teacher conference activity with a mentor teacher that integrates family engagement principles and strategies (InTASC 1e)

alignments.name: Intasc Standard 2
alignments.description: Explores personal biases and develops educational philosophy in areas of family engagement for professional growth and development (InTASC 2b) Identifies and evaluates family engagement principles and strategies observed within a family and/or community engagement setting (InTASC 2b)

alignments.name: Intasc Standard 6
alignments.description: Synthesizes and reflects on perspectives from diverse families and applies knowledge to own practices (InTASC 6d)

alignments.name: Intasc Standard 10
alignments.description: Evaluates, reflects, and synthesizes on effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement. (InTASC 10f)

badge_template_activities.title: Through evidence-based pedagogies, high-impact experiential learning, and fully integrated assessment, pre-service teachers will have the opportunity to (1) identify and evaluate principles and strategies of family engagement; (2) observe and evaluate impact of school activities in reaching families and supporting student learning; and (3) create, deliver, and reflect on an activity that incorporates competencies in family engagement.

526601f4-b8e0-43a4-b94a-369dcb5e96cf.description: The Classroom Management (CM) MicroCredential is designed to provide pre-service teachers with the knowledge and skills to effectively manage classrooms at a variety of grade levels and in diverse settings. Integrating evidence-based pedagogies, high-impact field experiences, and performance-based assessments, participants will demonstrate competencies and achievements as knowledge generators in classrooms and change makers in their professions and our communities.
526601f4-b8e0-43a4-b94a-369dcb5e96cf.name: Classroom Management

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: Intasc Standard 3
alignments.description: Analyzes and summarizes various classroom management strategies designed to meet the needs of diverse classroom(s) (INTASC 3d, 3k). Evaluates and reflects on organization and management strategies observed in diverse classrooms (INTASC 3d, 3k) Integrates and implements strategies as appropriate for the learning contexts (INTASC 3d, 3f, 3k)

alignments.name: Intasc Standard 9
alignments.description: Assesses options and plans actions (INTASC 9b, 9e) Reflects on actions and areas for personal and professional growth (INTASC 9l)

badge_template_activities.title: Through various activities, pre-service will have the opportunity to (1) identify and evaluate Classroom Management principles and strategies; (2) observe and evaluate Classroom Management practices and impact on student learning in a classroom setting; and (3) create, deliver, and reflect on a learning activity that incorporates successful Classroom Management principles and strategies.

76b721f2-ee0d-42ea-92e4-afaf8c86f8a1.description: Designed for novice teachers to demonstrate competency in Culturally Responsive Practices by 1) identifying and evaluating principles and strategies of Culturally Responsive Practices; (2) applying and reflecting on Culturally Responsive Practices in their own classrooms; (3) demonstrating competency and value of equitable Culturally Responsive Practices in the classroom and school; and (4) evaluating and reflecting on the impact of Culturally Responsive Practices on school activities.
76b721f2-ee0d-42ea-92e4-afaf8c86f8a1.name: Maryland Accelerates: Culturally-Responsive Practices

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: High-Leverage Teaching Practices
alignments.description: High-leverage practices are the fundamentals of teaching. These practices are used constantly and are critical to helping students learn important content. The high-leverage practices are also central to supporting students’ social and emotional development. These high-leverage practices are used across subject areas, grade levels, and contexts.

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium
alignments.description: InTASC Core Teaching Standards outline what teachers should know and be able to do to ensure every PK-12 student reaches the goal of being ready to enter college or the workforce. This “common core” outlines the principles and foundations of teaching practice that cut across all subject areas and grade levels and that all teachers share.

badge_template_activities.title: Synthesizes culturally responsive principles and strategies applicable in the classroom, and their impact on the professional growth and development of fellows and coaches. (InTASC 1b, 1d, 2j, 4b, 8e, 8k, 8p; HLP 12, 19)
Identifies and evaluates culturally responsive principles and strategies observed within the classroom setting and during instruction. (InTASC 2a, 2d, 2l, 6e; HLP 12, 19)
Synthesizes and reflects on perspectives of best practices on culturally responsive principles and strategies and applies knowledge to own classroom practices. (InTASC 2m, 2n, 3d, 7b, 8r; HLP 12, 19)
3.1 Designs and delivers learning experiences that integrate culturally responsive principles, practices, and strategies. (InTASC 2j, 2k, 3a; HLP 12, 19).
Evaluates, reflects, and synthesizes the effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for self-improvement. (InTASC 3f; HLP 12, 19)

4f9bede7-525c-4a9b-b847-12e66c9ec780.description: Designed for new teachers to develop, demonstrate, and communicate competencies in identifying and reducing behaviors that interfere with academic engagement by (1) identifying and evaluating how the function of a behavior influences classroom instruction and interactions; (2) observing and evaluating the impact of behavior on academic engagement in a classroom setting; and (3) creating, delivering, and reflecting on a classroom observation that leads to a behavior support plan.
4f9bede7-525c-4a9b-b847-12e66c9ec780.name: Maryland Accelerates Behavior Support Plans

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: High-Leverage Teaching Practices
alignments.description: High-leverage practices are the fundamentals of teaching. These practices are used constantly and are critical to helping students learn important content. The high-leverage practices are also central to supporting students’ social and emotional development. These high-leverage practices are used across subject areas, grade levels, and contexts.

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium
alignments.description: InTASC Core Teaching Standards outline what teachers should know and be able to do to ensure every PK-12 student reaches the goal of being ready to enter college or the workforce. This “common core” outlines the principles and foundations of teaching practice that cut across all subject areas and grade levels and that all teachers share.

badge_template_activities.title: Explores and reflects on how the function of a behavior in an educational setting limits academic engagement (InTASC 1a, 2a; HLP 7).
Explores, identifies, and synthesizes knowledge of behavior support plans to increase learning and development for all students (InTASC 2f, 3k, 9h; HLP 7, 13).
Identifies and evaluates behavior support plan principles and strategies observed in a classroom setting (InTASC 2g, 6l, 9h; HLP 7)
Evaluates, documents, and reflects how contexts influence behavior support plan strategies used to increase academic engagement in diverse settings (InTASC 2j; HLP 7, 19)
Designs and delivers a behavior support plan based on a classroom observation to better engage and support student learning (InTASC 6a, 6g, 6l; HLP 7)
Evaluates and reflects on effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement (InTASC 9h, 9l; HLP 7, 19)

cb48674f-8dea-447a-87ab-65464c37bf31.description: Designed for novice teachers to demonstrate competencies in High Leverage Practices by 1) identifying and evaluating how high leverage practices utilized within the classroom promote access to the curriculum; 2) observing and evaluating the impact of the high leverage practices of eliciting and interpreting individual student’s thinking and diagnosing patterns in student thinking; and 3) creating, delivering, and reflecting on an action plan that incorporates the core practices.
cb48674f-8dea-447a-87ab-65464c37bf31.name: Maryland Accelerates High-Leverage Practices

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: High-Leverage Teaching Practices
alignments.description: High-leverage practices are the fundamentals of teaching. These practices are used constantly and are critical to helping students learn important content. The high-leverage practices are also central to supporting students’ social and emotional development. These high-leverage practices are used across subject areas, grade levels, and contexts.

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium
alignments.description: InTASC Core Teaching Standards outline what teachers should know and be able to do to ensure every PK-12 student reaches the goal of being ready to enter college or the workforce. This “common core” outlines the principles and foundations of teaching practice that cut across all subject areas and grade levels and that all teachers share.

badge_template_activities.title: Explores and reflects on their beliefs and expectations about how their instructional decisions will foster learning with their students (InTASC 2d, 2j; HLP 3, 4).
Explores, identifies, and synthesizes elements of the core practices of eliciting and interpreting student’s thinking and diagnosing patterns of student thinking (InTASC 2j; HLP 3, 4, 12).
Identifies and evaluates high leverage principles and strategies observed in a classroom setting (InTASC 2g; HLP 3, 4, 19)

Evaluates, documents, and reflects how contexts influence teaching strategies and on the use of high leverage principles and strategies to address and understand students’ thinking and to understand their diverse learning needs (InTASC 2d, 2m, 2n, 5p, 10q; HLP 3, 4, 19)
Designs and delivers a learning experience integrating cultural diversity and growth mindset to better engage and support student learning (InTASC 2a, 9e, 10d; HLP 3, 4, 19)
Evaluates and reflects on effectiveness of delivery, impact on student learning, and strategies for improvement (InTASC 9l, 9m; HLP 3, 4, 19)

0c62ca7b-b3ea-41bd-a2e9-2b759ea88d91.description: Designed to provide master teachers with the knowledge and skills to effectively emerge as leaders and instructional coaches within their school communities by (1) identifying personalized professional learning goals; (2) observing and evaluating research-based teaching practices and the impact on student learning; and (3) designing, delivering, and reflecting upon a professional development session designed for a professional learning community.
0c62ca7b-b3ea-41bd-a2e9-2b759ea88d91.name: Maryland Accelerates Building Teacher Leadership Capacity

issuer.summary: issued by Frostburg State University College of Education

entity.name: Frostburg State University College of Education

alignments.name: High-Leverage Teaching Practices
alignments.description: High-leverage practices are the fundamentals of teaching. These practices are used constantly and are critical to helping students learn important content. The high-leverage practices are also central to supporting students’ social and emotional development. These high-leverage practices are used across subject areas, grade levels, and contexts.

alignments.name: Interstate Teacher Assessment and Support Consortium
alignments.description: InTASC Core Teaching Standards outline what teachers should know and be able to do to ensure every PK-12 student reaches the goal of being ready to enter college or the workforce. This “common core” outlines the principles and foundations of teaching practice that cut across all subject areas and grade levels and that all teachers share.

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrates awareness of the attributes of personalized professional learning (incorporating teachers’ voices, teachers as co-designers, social construction, and encouraging self-discovery) and establishes personalized professional learning goals (InTASC 9b)
Identifies, synthesizes, and reflects upon personalized learning goals including the opportunities and challenges that they present (InTASC 9b)
Analyzes mentor practice standards and identifies standards to focus on for personalized professional growth (InTASC 9b)
Explores Video-Stimulated Recall methodology and considers how it inspires teacher growth and strengthens confidence (InTASC 9b)
Develops as an instructional leader to advance mentoring, the teaching profession, and equitable outcomes for all students (InTASC 10f, 10i, & 10r; HLP 2 & 19)
Describes, evaluates, and reflects upon teaching and management strategies observed in diverse classrooms (InTASC 10f, 10i, & 10r; HLP 2 & 19)
Utilizes Video-Stimulated Recall methodology to inform reflective discourse following an observation (InTASC 10f, 10i, & 10r; HLP 2 & 19)
Promotes, designs, and facilitates professional learning aligned to professional teaching standards and district instructional goals (INTASC 10f, 10i, & 10n; HLP 1, 2 & 19)
Designs, promotes, and facilitates a presentation for a professional learning community of mentor teachers (InTASC 10f, 10i, & 10n; HLP 1, 2 & 19)

63b73897-2ef2-4b97-ac95-cd10c3b7ff56.description: Designed for teacher coaches to demonstrate competencies in Coaching High-Leverage Practices by 1) identifying and evaluating how high leverage practices utilized within the classroom; 2) observing and evaluating a novice teacher utilizing the high leverage practices of eliciting and interpreting individual student’s thinking and diagnosing patterns in student thinking; and 3) reviewing and reflecting on a novice teacher's action plan that incorporates the core practices.
63b73897-2ef2-4b97-ac95-cd10c3b7ff56.name: Maryland Accelerates Coaching High-Leverage Practices
